Sec. 21-208. Responsibility of operators.
It shall be unlawful for any operator, owner or any employee managing or conducting any business or other establishment to knowingly permit a juvenile to linger, stay, congregate, move about, wander or stroll upon the premises of the establishment during curfew hours. It is a defense to prosecution under of this article that the owner, operator, or employee notified the police department that a juvenile was present on the premises of the establishment during curfew hours and refused to leave after being asked to leave the premises.
